text: @mdreid @filterfish laughs
Why do we never do front of the envelope calculations?
Beer and coding. What a combination.
@mdreid congratulations!
Great quote by Alan Cox: "Stress testing is rarely useful here - things like ioctl races you find by thinking evil thoughts."
The best quote I've heard for a long time: "The bottom fell out of the beef"
How do people live with an operating system that doesn't have chroot?
ctrl-a :number <n> How to move a screen virtual terminal to another number. I love screen. It's my hero.
Usenix has opened up all it's conference proceedings: http://tinyurl.com/32pphf
Another bleak and rainy day ;-( But it is Friday. Yah :-D
It takes about one litre of oil to produce 5 litres of bottled water.
Using xmpp4r. XMPP is seriously cool.
@janl You can read slides: http://tinyurl.com/58rkgo. It's seems to outline the ideas in the paper.
How to work out how to deal with shite hosting companies
If anyone knows any *good* hosting companies please let me know.
Why is it hosting companies will take you money but not do a fucking thing to help when your VPS freezes after it's started init.
Just playing with event machine. It's a seriously funky bit of kit.
filterfish is very, very happy that the sawfish window manager appears to under active development again.
MySQL is a toy. That doesn't mean to say toys aren't useful. But it's still a toy.
A ruby gems warning: if gem can't allocate enough memory it will shit itself with no errors . Try using ruby --debug.
I love Unix/Linux. Suspend a process: kill -SIGSTOP <pid>. Restart said process kill -SIGSCONT <pid>. All just works.
git the vi of version control systems
@KathrynElliott Too much garlic? Never.
I find that delaying a sneeze for as long as possible gives a much more satisfying sneeze
The window is open. The sun is shining. Loud music playing. Life's good\!
Still trying to play Interpol's "Turn on the bright lights". Still haven't succeeded. Fucking amazing record.
@mdreid I'm doing document classification. I store the documents in couchdb, process them and then classify them using a bayesian filter.
Bored, Bored, Bored. Working for others, mutter, mutter.
Another Sunday over :-(
Must. Start. Work. Must. Stop. Procrastinating.
@KathrynElliott vi: one editor to rule them all.
Stopping work. I've got 87.5% success rate with 131 documents using a bayesian filter. Did someone say overfitting ...
@janl That's absolute genius!
@timriley Umm. I could do that. I might have to bone up the views though!
I've got 137 973 documents in a couchdb database. Works like a charm
I just found out water and oil don't repel each other; they're just not attracted to each other. Water likes itself more than oil.
@KathrynElliott. You can learn how to use the command line. It's pretty easy.
Twitter on the command line: Life's good
Fishie's tip of the day: Make sure you use enough water/milk when making your porridge.
I really wish I could remember the idiom: if $PROGRAM_NAME == __FILE__
Just about to test my new ruby/libsvm binding for real. Swig seriously cool.
I'm now one day over 40. Nothing much different. Still feel about 12!
I've finally got to grips with the machine learning (SVD, SVM, VSM) that I've been  working on for the last two weeks. I've a happy man!
I'm using duplicity to backup my development directories to Amazon S3. It's a beautiful thing: http://duplicity.nongnu.org/.
Doing some work for a client. It *so* less interesting than my own work. "Can you setup openvpn to not ask for a passwd". Ok. <sigh>
Just had a full day planning. It's amazing how useful issue trackers are.
Just about to do a deployment. It's always a bit nerve racking especially when there's a data migration involved.
Just done a bugfix with git: create a new branch based on a previous release; fix the defect, retag, merge to master. Release. Done! Nice.
I'm using the git plugin for trac. It's fantastic, you can reference a commit by putting @commit-id in your issues/wiki. Mavelous
I just got DDNS going. Hurrah.
I loath Vista. I've used openvpn for many years, linux, OSX, windows XP. On Vista it can't set the route up. IT'S SHITE.
I'm going to finally get this damn hosting sorted out!
Just set up openvz on my laptop. I love the fact that I can have multiple machines on my laptop. I can now get on the bus and do my work.
Just finished doing some work for a client. I hate integrating with proprietary shit.
My top three: make sure the site stays up, migrate dn to new machine, not collapse in a heap. I'm not sure which of those I'll achieve!
Why can't all websites use rss or atom. mutter, mutter {:(
Just getting stuck into RSpec. Something I've been meaning to do for ages.
I've just come up with a really funky architecture for an application that I'm writing. This make me happy.
I've just been listening to The Orb remix project for the first time in a few years. It's bloody good.
I just saw that twitterfeed uses tinyurl. Very neat!
It's still a very funky bit of kit.
I've decided to not use skynet as after a few moments of deep thought I don't think it's what I need.
My web24 vps has been commisioned. I'm, so far, seriously impressed. It took less than 10 minutes!
I'm looking at Skynet. Skynet is a map-reduce implementation. In short it makes '... distributed computing accessible'. It's seriously cool!
I've just signed up to web24 hosting. Ummm, I know what I'll be doing over the next few days.
